Articles.Content: Seems like a natural evolution... this is what happens once Kerbals discover technology for interstellar flight.

Haha, yeah.

Except they already have the tech for interstellar flight. They have Orion.

Seems like a natural evolution... this is what happens once Kerbals discover technology for interstellar flight.

Or just mutate when they get too much deep-space radiation.
That's what happens when you feed a Kerbal after midnight?
it was only a matter of time until I found another who thought the same thing.

That's what happens when you feed a Kerbal after midnight?

On the contrary - this is what happens when Kerbals are left without snacks for too long.

On the contrary - this is what happens when Kerbals are left without snacks for too long.

Jeb, grab a Snickers. You're not you when you're hungry.

Yikes.. they look like my exwife...

run, run away while you mortals can...
It is always a sign of great integrity when one attacks the looks of their former spouses to fit into an Internet thread
Uhm... in the series, the irkens are allways eating snacks...

exactly, because they weren't fed enough during their previous kerbal lives.

Come one come all, free snickers for all!

I'd say rather than primitive Irkins...

They're over-developed gherkins.

Yes, you heard it here, Kerbals are basically pickles.

I'd say rather than primitive Irkins...

They're over-developed gherkins.

Yes, you heard it here, Kerbals are basically pickles.

I now subscribe to this theory.

I'd say rather than primitive Irkins...

They're over-developed gherkins.

Yes, you heard it here, Kerbals are basically pickles.

No reason they can't be both.... someone needs to make an evolution of man diagram of this.

I'd say rather than primitive Irkins...

They're over-developed gherkins.

Yes, you heard it here, Kerbals are basically pickles.

Dill or sweet? So does that mean when my rocket explodes I should bring hot dogs because the relish is already there.

Yikes.. they look like my exwife...

Yet... you married her!

On the topic, the first thing my wife said when she saw the KSP "Munar Footage" trailer was "they remind me of Invader Zim", so I guess there's something to that, after all.
yes i did.. i also Divorced her...
